intro: Epilobium foliosum, commonly known as broadleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other species such as willowherbs and evening primroses. Epilobium foliosum is often found in wet meadows, stream banks, and other damp habitats.
